panels_needing_description.title: Schedule timeslices executed by each cpu
CPU time spent in user and system contexts

detailed_panels.title: CPU Busy
detailed_panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together

detailed_panels.title: Sys Load
detailed_panels.description: System load  over all CPU cores together

detailed_panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic
detailed_panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted

detailed_panels.title: CPU spent seconds in guests (VMs)
queries: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_guest_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="user"}[1m])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[1m])))

sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_guest_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="nice"}[1m])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[1m])))

detailed_panels.title: Schedule timeslices executed by each cpu
CPU time spent in user and system contexts
Disk IOps Completed
detailed_panels.description: The number (after merges) of I/O requests completed per second for the device

detailed_panels.title: Disk R/W Data
detailed_panels.description: The number of bytes read from or written to the device per second

detailed_panels.title: Disk Average Wait Time
detailed_panels.description: The average time for requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

detailed_panels.title: Average Queue Size
detailed_panels.description: The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device

detailed_panels.title: Disk R/W Merged
detailed_panels.description: The number of read and write requests merged per second that were queued to the device

detailed_panels.title: Time Spent Doing I/Os
detailed_panels.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.

detailed_panels.title: Instantaneous Queue Size
detailed_panels.description: The number of outstanding requests at the instant the sample was taken. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish.
